Yesterday, Litecoin finally completed its much-talked-about third halving event, meaning that the cryptocurrency‚Äôs block rewards have once again been halved from 12.5 LTC to 6.25 LTC.
While the event had some hype behind it, it turned out to be a ‚Äúbuy the rumor, sell the news‚Äù type of deal in the end, as the asset‚Äôs price has taken a notable hit since the event has taken place.
At the time of the halving, LTC was floating around $91, but after the selloff, the coin dropped to $86, which suggests a plunge greater than 5%.

entry.title: Biggest Movers: XRP, DOGE Bear Run Continues, Sending Prices to Multi-Week Lows
entry.summary:
XRP was one of Thursday‚Äôs notable movers, as the token dropped to a multi-week low in today‚Äôs session. The decline comes as the global market cap fell by as much as 2% over the course of the day. Dogecoin also declined, falling for a third consecutive session.
XRP
XRP, formerly ripple, remained in the red during today‚Äôs session, as the price fell to a multi-week low.
Following a high of $0.6971 the day prior, XRP/USD slipped to an intraday low of $0.6589 earlier in the day.
This is the weakest point that XRP has hit since July 13, when the token was trading below $0.4700.
That day also saw XRP hit its highest point since December 2021, after it was ruled by a U.S. judge not necessarily to be a security.
Since then, sentiment has been largely bearish, with the latest sell-off coming as the relative strength index (RSI) broke out of a floor at 49.00.
At the time of writing, the index is tracking at 48.60, with the next visible point of support at 45.00.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Dogecoin (DOGE) extended its own stay in bearish territory on Thursday, as the meme coin fell by as much as 5% today.
The decline saw DOGE/USD drop to an intraday low at $0.07305, less than 24 hours after peaking at $0.07703.
As a result of this sell-off, dogecoin has fallen to its lowest level since July 24, which is the last time price was trading at a support of $0.07000.
Similar to XRP above, Thursday‚Äôs decline comes as a result of price strength falling below a floor at 51.00.
The RSI is currently at a reading of 50.23, with DOGE trading at $0.07339, which is marginally above today‚Äôs bottom.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Where do you expect the next price target for dogecoin traders? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Robinhood Sets New Low For Crypto Transaction Revenue With $31 Million Loss
entry.summary:
After-hours trading on Wednesday saw a nearly 7% decline in shares of Robinhood after the online broker announced a profitable quarter for the first time as a publicly traded firm, but witnessed a decline in monthly active users, dealing a blow to its crypto balances.
The decline in active users cost Robinhood‚Äôs cryptocurrency trading business $31 million in the second quarter. In comparison to the $38 million that the company made in the first three months of this year, this amount represents an 18% drop, according to its most recent financial announcement.
Robinhood: Shifting Market Dynamics
Robinhood, which was formerly lauded for its innovative strategy of democratizing stock trading by doing away with trading commissions, has had to adjust to shifting market dynamics, which have‚Ä¶

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdiƒá, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI

Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO

entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers

Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
